metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9942 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A sandbox information disclosure exists in Twig before 1.38.0 and 2.x before 2.7.0 because, under some circumstances, it is possible to call the __toString() method on an object even if not allowed by the security policy in place.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-9942` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

php-twig - 2.6.2-2
php-twig-cache-extra - 2.6.2-2
php-twig-cssinliner-extra - 2.6.2-2
php-twig-extra-bundle - 2.6.2-2
php-twig-html-extra - 2.6.2-2
php-twig-inky-extra - 2.6.2-2
php-twig-intl-extra - 2.6.2-2
php-twig-markdown-extra - 2.6.2-2
php-twig-string-extra - 2.6.2-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: php-twig package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.6.2-2').
